title: Fix GNU extension warnings (25 occurrences)
description: GNU-specific extensions: void pointer arithmetic (14) and variable-sized struct fields not at end (11). Consider portable alternatives.

title: Remove unused functions (45 occurrences)
description: Unused static functions, mostly from SPLAY_PROTOTYPE macro expansions. May need to mark with __attribute__((unused)) or restructure macros.

title: Fix macro redefinitions (75 occurrences)
description: Macros being redefined, likely from conflicting headers or config.h issues.

title: Fix variable shadowing warnings (10 occurrences)
description: Local variables shadowing other locals or parameters. Rename variables for clarity.

title: Fix const cast warnings (51 occurrences)
description: Casts that drop const qualifier. Review if the called function actually modifies data or if signature should be updated.

title: Fix miscellaneous warnings (25 occurrences)
description: Remaining warnings: strict-prototypes (8), format-nonliteral (7), pointer-sign (4), deprecated-declarations (3), missing-field-initializers (3).

title: Fix signed/unsigned comparison warnings (54 occurrences)
description: Comparisons between signed int and unsigned types (size_t, unsigned long). Use appropriate casts or change variable types.

title: Add missing function prototypes (206 occurrences)
description: Functions declared without prototypes trigger -Wmissing-prototypes. Add static keyword for internal functions or add declarations to headers.

comments.author: mich
comments.text: Fixed 24 missing prototypes in ipfrag.c, router.c, config.c by adding static keyword to internal functions. Remaining: 182

comments.author: mich
comments.text: Fixed 47 total (24+23) missing prototypes. Remaining: 159. Files fixed: ipfrag.c, router.c, config.c, util.c, interface.c, osfp.c, keycount.c, ethernet.c, rrdtool.c

title: Fix const-correctness warnings (208 occurrences)
description: String literals and const pointers passed to functions expecting non-const char*. Fix by updating function signatures to accept const char* where data isn't modified.
